member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAntialiasing
member.summary: Specifies the antialiasing mode for non-text primitives.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAntialiasing.Antialiased
member.summary: Edges are antialiased using a high quality per-primitive method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAntialiasing.Aliased
member.summary: Edges are aliased.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend
member.summary: Specifies the blend mode used to draw primitives.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend.SourceOver
member.summary: The standard source-over-destination blend mode, also known as premultiplied alpha blending.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend.Copy
member.summary: The source is copied to the destination; destination pixels are ignored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend.Min
member.summary: Use the minimum of the source and destination pixel values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasBlend.Add
member.summary: Take the sum of the source and destination pixel values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasCapStyle
member.summary: Describes the shape at the end of a line or segment.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasCapStyle.Flat
member.summary: A cap that does not extend past the last point of the line. If CanvasStrokeStyle.DashCap is set to Flat, dots will have zero size so only dashes are visible.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasCapStyle.Square
member.summary: Half of a square that has a length equal to the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasCapStyle.Round
member.summary: A semicircle that has a diameter equal to the line thickness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasCapStyle.Triangle
member.summary: An isosceles right triangle whose hypotenuse is equal in length to the thickness of the line.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasDashStyle
member.summary: Describes the sequence of dashes, dots, and gaps in a stroke style.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasDashStyle.Solid
member.summary: A solid line with no breaks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasDashStyle.Dash
member.summary: A dash followed by a gap of equal length. The dash and the gap are each twice as long as the stroke thickness. The equivalent custom dash style is { 2, 2 }.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasDashStyle.Dot
member.summary: A dot followed by a longer gap. The equivalent custom dash style is { 0, 2 }.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasDashStyle.DashDot
member.summary: A dash, followed by a gap, followed by a dot, followed by another gap. The equivalent custom dash style is { 2, 2, 0, 2 }.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasDashStyle.DashDotDot
member.summary: A dash, followed by a gap, followed by a dot, followed by another gap, followed by another dot, followed by another gap. The equivalent custom dash style is { 2, 2, 0, 2, 0, 2 }.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel
member.summary: Indicates the type of information provided when the Direct2D Debug Layer is enabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel.None
member.summary: No debugging output.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel.Error
member.summary: Only error messages are output.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel.Warning
member.summary: Error messages and warnings are output.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasDebugLevel.Information
member.summary: Error messages, warnings, and additional diagnostic information that can help improve performance are output.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasLineJoin
member.summary: Describes the shape that joins two lines or segments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasLineJoin.Miter
member.summary: Regular angular vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasLineJoin.Bevel
member.summary: Beveled vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasLineJoin.Round
member.summary: Rounded vertices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasLineJoin.MiterOrBevel
member.summary: Regular angular vertices unless the join would extend beyond the miter limit; otherwise, beveled vertices.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasStrokeTransformBehavior
member.summary: Defines how the world transform, dots per inch (DPI), and stroke width affect the shape of the pen used to stroke a primitive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasStrokeTransformBehavior.Normal
member.summary: The stroke respects the currently set world transform, the DPI, and the stroke width.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasStrokeTransformBehavior.Fixed
member.summary: The stroke does not respect the world transform but it does respect the DPI and stroke width.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasStrokeTransformBehavior.Hairline
member.summary: The stroke is forced to 1 pixel wide (in device space) and does not respect the world transform, the DPI, or the stroke width.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextAntialiasing
member.summary: Specifies the antialiasing mode for drawing text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextAntialiasing.Auto
member.summary: Automatically choose the text antialiasing mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextAntialiasing.ClearType
member.summary: Use ClearType antialiasing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextAntialiasing.Grayscale
member.summary: Use grayscale antialiasing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextAntialiasing.Aliased
member.summary: Do not use antialiasing.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasUnits
member.summary: Specifies what units coordinates are in. This is important for making sure everything stays in the right place when running on high DPI devices.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasUnits.Dips
member.summary: Units are interpreted as device-independent pixels. This matches the behavior of the XAML UI framework.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasUnits.Pixels
member.summary: Units are interpreted as pixels. This matches the Direct3D graphics API.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasEdgeBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the way in which a brush paints areas outside its typical content region.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasEdgeBehavior.Clamp
member.summary: Repeat the edge pixels of the brush's content.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasEdgeBehavior.Wrap
member.summary: Tile the brush's content.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasEdgeBehavior.Mirror
member.summary: Tile the the brush's content, and flip each alternate tile.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation
member.summary: Specifies the quality used for image resizing and transforms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation.NearestNeighbor
member.summary: Samples the nearest single point and uses that exact color. This option is the fastest, but outputs the lowest quality image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation.Linear
member.summary: Uses a four point sample and linear interpolation. Compared to NearestNeighbor, this option is slower but outputs a higher quality image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation.Cubic
member.summary: Uses a 16 sample cubic kernel for interpolation. This mode uses the most processing time, but outputs a higher quality image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation.MultiSampleLinear
member.summary: Uses 4 linear samples within a single pixel for good edge anti-aliasing. This mode is good for scaling down by small amounts on images with few pixels.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation.Anisotropic
member.summary: Uses anisotropic filtering to sample a pattern according to the transformed shape of the image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasImageInterpolation.HighQualityCubic
member.summary: Uses a variable size high quality cubic kernel to perform a pre-downscale the image if downscaling is involved in the transform matrix. Then uses the cubic interpolation mode for the final output.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasActiveLayer
member.summary: Layers can change opacity, apply opacity masks, or clip a group of drawing operations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasActiveLayer.Dispose
member.summary: Closes the layer, applying the specified blend and/or clip operations to everything that has been drawn inside it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLayerOptions
member.summary: Advanced options specifying how layer contents should be prepared.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLayerOptions.None
member.summary: Default layer behavior. The layer contents are cleared to transparent black.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLayerOptions.InitializeFromBackground
member.summary: The layer is not cleared to transparent black. Instead it inherits the existing background colors that lie behind it.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasLayerOptions.IgnoreAlpha
member.summary: The layer ignores alpha. All content rendered into the layer will be treated as opaque.

member.summary: The alpha value has been premultiplied. In blending, each color is scaled by the alpha value. Note that the alpha value itself is the same in both straight and premultiplied alpha. Typically, no color channel value is greater than the alpha channel value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAlphaMode.Straight
member.summary: The alpha channel indicates the transparency of the color.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasAlphaMode.Ignore
member.summary: The alpha value is ignored.

member.summary: Indicates why a CreateResources event was raised.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.UI.CanvasCreateResourcesReason.FirstTime
member.summary: First time resource creation. Everything must be created from scratch.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.UI.CanvasCreateResourcesReason.NewDevice
member.summary: A new device has been created, to recover from a lost device error. All graphics resources must be recreated, but other data (for example memory buffers that were previously loaded from the filesystem) may be reused.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.UI.CanvasCreateResourcesReason.DpiChanged
member.summary: The display DPI has changed. Only resources that depend on DPI need to be recreated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.UI.Xaml.CanvasControl.UseSharedDevice
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this control should create a new device each time, or use a device which may common between other controls.

member.summary: Gets or sets the whether the devices that this control creates will be forced to software rendering.

member.summary: Gets or sets an application-chosen device for this control.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.UI.Xaml.CanvasControl.DpiScale
member.summary: Gets or sets a scaling factor applied to this control's Dpi.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite
member.summary: The composite mode used for the effect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceOver
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationOver
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S + D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceIn
member.summary: Intersection of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = DA * S.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationIn
member.summary: Intersection of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = SA * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceOut
member.summary: Region of the source bitmap. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationOut
member.summary: Region of the destination bitmap. Equation: O = (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.SourceAtop
member.summary: Region of the destination bitmap. Equation: O = DA * S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.DestinationAtop
member.summary: Region of the source bitmap. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S + SA * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.Xor
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps with xor function for pixels that overlap. Equation: O = (1 - DA) * S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.Add
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps. Equation: O = S + D.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.Copy
member.summary: Region of the source bitmap. Equation: O = S.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.BoundedCopy
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps with no destination override. Equation: O = S (only where source exists).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.CanvasComposite.MaskInvert
member.summary: Union of source and destination bitmaps with unchanged alpha. Equation: O = (1 - D) * S + (1 - SA) * D.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFileFormatType
member.summary: Indicates the file format of a font face.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFileFormatType.Cff
member.summary: An OpenType font face with CFF outlines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFileFormatType.TrueType
member.summary: An OpenType font face with TrueType outlines.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFileFormatType.TrueTypeCollection
member.summary: An OpenType font face that is a part of a TrueType collection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFileFormatType.Type1
member.summary: A Type 1 font face.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFileFormatType.Vector
member.summary: A vector .FON format font face.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFileFormatType.Bitmap
member.summary: A bitmap .FON format font face.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFileFormatType.Unknown
member.summary: Font face type is not recognized by the DirectWrite font system.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFileFormatType.RawCff
member.summary: The font data includes only the CFF table from an OpenType CFF font. This font face type can be used only for embedded fonts (i.e., custom font file loaders) and the resulting font face object supports only the minimum functionality necessary to render glyphs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation
member.summary: Specifies an informational string embedded in a font file.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.None
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the unspecified name ID.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.CopyrightNotice
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the copyright notice provided by the font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.VersionStrings
member.summary: Indicates the string containing a version number.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.Trademark
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the trademark information provided by the font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.Manufacturer
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the name of the font manufacturer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.Designer
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the name of the font designer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.DesignerUrl
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the URL of the font designer (with protocol, e.g., http://, ftp://).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.Description
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the description of the font. This may also contain revision information, usage recommendations, history, features, and so on.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.FontVendorUrl
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the URL of the font vendor (with protocol, e.g., http://, ftp://). If a unique serial number is embedded in the URL, it can be used to register the font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.LicenseDescription
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the description of how the font may be legally used, or different example scenarios for licensed use.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.LicenseInfoUrl
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the URL where additional licensing information can be found.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.Win32FamilyNames
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the GDI-compatible family name. Since GDI allows a maximum of four fonts per family, fonts in the same family may have different GDI-compatible family names (e.g., "Arial", "Arial Narrow", "Arial Black").

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.Win32SubfamilyNames
member.summary: Indicates the string containing a GDI-compatible subfamily name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.PreferredFamilyNames
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the family name preferred by the designer. This enables font designers to group more than four fonts in a single family without losing compatibility with GDI. This name is typically only present if it differs from the GDI-compatible family name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.PreferredSubfamilyNames
member.summary: Indicates the string containing the subfamily name preferred by the designer. This name is typically only present if it differs from the GDI-compatible subfamily name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.SampleText
member.summary: Contains sample text for display in font lists. This can be the font name or any other text that the designer thinks is the best example to display the font in.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.FullName
member.summary: The full name of the font- e.g. "Arial Bold", from name id 4 in the name table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.PostscriptName
member.summary: The postscript name of the font, like GillSans-Bold, from name id 6 in the name table.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.PostscriptCidName
member.summary: The postscript CID findfont name, from name id 20 in the name table

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.WwsFamilyName
member.summary: Family name for the weight-width-slope model.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.DesignScriptLanguageTag
member.summary: Script/language tag to identify the scripts or languages that the font was primarily designed to support.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontInformation.SupportedScriptLanguageTag
member.summary: Script/language tag to identify the scripts or languages that the font declares it is able to support.

member.summary: Releases all resources used by the CanvasFontFace.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.Ascent
member.summary: Gets the ascent value of the font face. Ascent is the distance from the top of font character alignment box to the Latin-script baseline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.CapHeight
member.summary: Gts the cap height value of the font face. Cap height is the distance from the Latin-script baseline to the top of a typical Latin-script capital. Capital "H" is often used as a reference character for the purpose of calculating the cap height value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.CaretOffset
member.summary: Gets the horizontal offset of the caret along the baseline for good appearance. An offset of 0 is returned for perfectly upright fonts (non-italic).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.CaretSlopeRise
member.summary: Gets the vertical rise of the caret. CaretSlopeRise / CaretSlopeRun yields the caret angle. A rise value of 1 is returned for perfectly upright fonts (non-italic).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.CaretSlopeRun
member.summary: Gets the horizontal run of the caret. CaretSlopeRise / CaretSlopeRun yields the caret angle. A run value of 0 for perfectly upright fonts (non-italic).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.Descent
member.summary: Gets the descent value of the font face in font design units. Descent is the distance from the bottom of font character alignment box to the Latin-script baseline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.FaceNames
member.summary: Gets a map of localized strings that contain the face names for the font (for example, Regular or Bold).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.FamilyNames
member.summary: [Win10] Gets a map of localized strings that contain the family name for the font (for example, Arial, Segoe UI, or Comic Sans MS).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.FileFormatType
member.summary: Gets the file format type of a font face.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.GlyphBox
member.summary: Gets the accumulated draw bounds of all glyphs in the font.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.GlyphCount
member.summary: Gets the number of glyphs in the font.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.HasTypographicMetrics
member.summary: Gets whether the ascent, descent, and lineGap are based on newer 'typographic' values in the font, rather than legacy values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.HasVerticalGlyphVariants
member.summary: Gets whether the font has any vertical glyph variants.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.IsMonospaced
member.summary: Gets whether the font is monospaced; that is, all glyphs' layout boxes are equally sized and spaced apart.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.IsSymbolFont
member.summary: Gets whether the font is a symbol font.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.LineGap
member.summary: Gets the line gap for the font. This is the recommended additional white space to add between lines.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.LowercaseLetterHeight
member.summary: Gets the lowercase letter height of the font face. This is the distance from the Latin-script baseline to the top of lowercase letter "x", or a similar lowercase character.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.Simulations
member.summary: Gets the algorithmic style simulation flags of a font face.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.Stretch
member.summary: Gets the the degree to which the font is stretched, compared to the normal aspect ratio of that font.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.StrikethroughPosition
member.summary: Gets the strikethrough position, which is relative to the Latin-script baseline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.StrikethroughThickness
member.summary: Gets the thickness of the strikethrough for this font.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.Style
member.summary: Gets whether the typeface is oblique, or italic, or the default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.SubscriptPosition
member.summary: Gets the subscript position, which is relative to the baseline origin.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.SubscriptSize
member.summary: Gets the size of a subscript.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.SuperscriptPosition
member.summary: Gets the superscript position, which is relative to the baseline origin.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.SuperscriptSize
member.summary: Gets the size of a superscript.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.UnderlinePosition
member.summary: Gets the underline position, relative to the Latin-script baseline.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.UnderlineThickness
member.summary: Gets the thickness of underlines.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontFace.UnicodeRanges
member.summary: Gets a list of character ranges supported by a font.

member.summary: Gets the weight of this font.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontSimulations
member.summary: Describes algorithmic style simulations that can be applied to the font face.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontSimulations.None
member.summary: Indicates that no simulations are applied to the font face.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontSimulations.Bold
member.summary: Indicates that algorithmic emboldening is applied to the font face.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasFontSimulations.Oblique
member.summary: Indicates that algorithmic italicization is applied to the font face.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextMeasuringMode
member.summary: Indicates the measuring method used for a piece of text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextMeasuringMode.Natural
member.summary: Specifies that text is measured using glyph ideal metrics whose values are independent to the current display resolution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextMeasuringMode.GdiClassic
member.summary: Specifies that text is measured using glyph display-compatible metrics whose values tuned for the current display resolution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextMeasuringMode.GdiNatural
member.summary: Specifies that text is measured using the same glyph display metrics as text measured by GDI using a font created with the CLEARTYPE_NATURAL_QUALITY GDI option.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasUnicodeRange
member.summary: Represents a range, from starting to ending code points, of Unicode characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasUnicodeRange.First
member.summary: The first code point in the Unicode range.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasUnicodeRange.Last
member.summary: The last code point in the Unicode range.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyphMetrics
member.summary: Represents the metrics of an individual glyph in em units.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyphMetrics.LeftSideBearing
member.summary: Specifies the X offset from the glyph origin to the left edge of the black box. The glyph origin is the current horizontal writing position. A negative value means the black box extends to the left of the origin (often true for lowercase italic 'f').

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyphMetrics.AdvanceWidth
member.summary: Specifies the X offset from the origin of the current glyph to the origin of the next glyph when writing horizontally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyphMetrics.RightSideBearing
member.summary: Specifies the X offset from the right edge of the black box to the origin of the next glyph when writing horizontally. The value is negative when the right edge of the black box overhangs the layout box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyphMetrics.TopSideBearing
member.summary: Specifies the vertical offset from the vertical origin to the top of the black box. Thus, a positive value adds whitespace whereas a negative value means the glyph overhangs the top of the layout box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyphMetrics.AdvanceHeight
member.summary: Specifies the Y offset from the vertical origin of the current glyph to the vertical origin of the next glyph when writing vertically. Note that the term "origin" by itself denotes the horizontal origin. The vertical origin is different. Its Y coordinate is specified by verticalOriginY value, and its X coordinate is half the advanceWidth to the right of the horizontal origin.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyphMetrics.BottomSideBearing
member.summary: Specifies the vertical distance from the bottom edge of the black box to the advance height. This is positive when the bottom edge of the black box is within the layout box, or negative when the bottom edge of black box overhangs the layout box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyphMetrics.VerticalOrigin
member.summary: Specifies the Y coordinate of a glyph's vertical origin, in the font's design coordinate system. The y coordinate of a glyph's vertical origin is the sum of the glyph's top side bearing and the top (that is, yMax) of the glyph's bounding box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasGlyphMetrics.DrawBounds
member.summary: Specifies the bounds of the parts of the glyph are covered if the glyph is drawn.

member.summary: Gets the bounds of a glyph run using this font face, using the specified measuring mode.

member.summary: Used for specifying how two geometries should be combined to form a third, new geometry.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometryCombine.Union
member.summary: The result geometry contains the set of all areas from either of the source geometries.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometryCombine.Intersect
member.summary: The result geometry contains just the areas where the source geometries overlap.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometryCombine.Xor
member.summary: The result geometry contains the areas from both the source geometries, except for any parts where they overlap.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGeometryCombine.Exclude
member.summary: The result geometry contains any area that is in the first source geometry- but excludes any area belonging to the second geometry.

member.summary: A path builder is used for creating freeform objects.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasArcSize
member.summary: Specifies whether an arc should take the longer, or shorter way, around the ellipse to join its start and end points.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasArcSize.Small
member.summary: Denotes that the angle of an arc's sweep should be π or less.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasArcSize.Large
member.summary: Denotes that the angle of an arc's sweep should be π or greater.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureFill
member.summary: Specifies whether the interior of the figure is considered filled, for the purpose of drawing and geometry operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureFill.Default
member.summary: Specifies that the figure's interior may be filled using , and its interior is used by geometry operations that operate on fill.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureFill.DoesNotAffectFills
member.summary: Specifies that the figure will not affect calls, and its fill will not affect any geometry operations. Of course, the figure may still cause visible drawing with .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureLoop
member.summary: Specifies whether the figure is open or closed. This affects the appearance of fills and strokes, as well as geometry operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureLoop.Open
member.summary: Specifies that the figure may not necessarily begin and end with the same point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureLoop.Closed
member.summary: Specifies that the figure will be automatically closed, by connecting its end point back to its start point.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureSegmentOptions
member.summary: Specifies some advanced properties that may be specified when defining a figure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureSegmentOptions.None
member.summary: Specifies the default behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureSegmentOptions.ForceUnstroked
member.summary: Specifies that the segments of the figure will not appear stroked, for example, when drawn with .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFigureSegmentOptions.ForceRoundLineJoin
member.summary: Forces the segment to apply a round line join, even if the operation on the geometry was set to use some other, non-round line join.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFilledRegionDetermination
member.summary: Specifies how to determine which parts of a path are considered filled or unfilled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFilledRegionDetermination.Alternate
member.summary: Specifies that self-intersecting regions are considered 'filled' based on the Alternate fill rule.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasFilledRegionDetermination.Winding
member.summary: Specifies that self-intersecting regions are considered 'filled' based on the Winding fill rule.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasSweepDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction that an elliptical arc is drawn.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasSweepDirection.CounterClockwise
member.summary: Arcs are drawn in a counterclockwise (negative-angle) direction.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasSweepDirection.Clockwise
member.summary: Arcs are drawn in a clockwise (positive-angle) direction.

member.summary: Specifies word wrapping behavior.

member.summary: Words are broken across lines to avoid text overflowing the layout box.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasWordWrapping.NoWrap
member.summary: Words are kept within the same line even when it overflows the layout box. This option is often used with scrolling to reveal overflow text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasWordWrapping.EmergencyBreak
member.summary: Words are broken across lines to avoid text overflowing the layout box. Emergency wrapping occurs if the word is larger than the maximum width.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasWordWrapping.WholeWord
member.summary: When emergency wrapping, only wrap whole words, never breaking words when the layout width is too small for even a single word.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasWordWrapping.Character
member.summary: Wrap between any valid character clusters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasLineSpacingMode
member.summary: [Win10] Options for specifying how lines are spaced apart.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasLineSpacingMode.Default
member.summary: Automatically positioned, if is negative; otherwise, LineSpacing and LineSpacingBaseline are treated as a quantities in DIPs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasLineSpacingMode.Uniform
member.summary: Spacing is affected by the absolute value of LineSpacing, and vertical offset of the text is determined by LineSpacingBaseline. LineSpacing and LineSpacingBaseline are treated as a quantities in DIPs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasLineSpacingMode.Proportional
member.summary: Spacing is affected by the absolute value of LineSpacing, and vertical offset of the text is determined by LineSpacingBaseline. LineSpacing and LineSpacingBaseline are treated as a ratio of the default.

member.summary: Indicates that breaks are determined by the neighboring text span or inline object.

member.summary: Indicates that breaks are allowed, unless overruled by the neighboring text span or inline object: either prohibited by a CannotBreak or forced by a MustBreak.

member.summary: Indicates that there should be no line break, unless overruled by a MustBreak from the neighboring text span or inline object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasLineBreakCondition.MustBreak
member.summary: Indicates that a line break must happen, regardless of anything else.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasVerticalGlyphOrientation.Default
member.summary: With this default option and vertical layout, naturally horizontal scripts, such as Latin script, rotate 90 degrees clockwise, while ideographic scripts, such as Chinese, remain upright.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasVerticalGlyphOrientation.Stacked
member.summary: With this option and vertical layout, ideographic scripts that permit stacking, such as Latin script, appear stacked, and are not rotated. Connected scripts, such as Arabic, which would otherwise look broken if glyphs were kept at 0 degrees, remain connected and rotate.

Signals to the app that it should draw an underline.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextGridFit
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable gridfitting behavior for glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextGridFit.Default
member.summary: Gridfitting is enabled or disabled based on font table information for the text being drawn.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextGridFit.Disable
member.summary: Gridfitting is always disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextGridFit.Enable
member.summary: Gridfitting is always enabled.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextRenderingMode
member.summary: Specifies the behavior when glyphs are rendered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextRenderingMode.Default
member.summary: The behavior is determined automatically, based on the font and text size.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextRenderingMode.Aliased
member.summary: No anti-aliasing is performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextRenderingMode.GdiClassic
member.summary: Antialiasing is performed in the horizontal direction, and the appearance of glyphs is layout-compatible with GDI when GDI's CLEARTYPE_QUALITY option is used. This option is unlikely to be used by WinRT apps. It's intended for backwards compatibility with legacy rendering.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextRenderingMode.GdiNatural
member.summary: Antialiasing is performed in the horizontal direction, and the appearance of glyphs is compatible with GDI when GDI's CLEARTYPE_NATRUAL_QUALITY option is used. This option is unlikely to be used by WinRT apps. It's intended for backwards compatibility with legacy rendering.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextRenderingMode.Natural
member.summary: Antialiasing is performed in the horizontal direction. This allows glyphs to be positioned with horizontally subpixel precision.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextRenderingMode.NaturalSymmetric
member.summary: Similar to Natural except antialiasing is performed in both the horizontal and vertical directions. This is typically used at larger sizes to make curves and diagonal lines look smoother.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextRenderingMode.NaturalSymmetricDownsampled
member.summary: [Win10] Similar to NaturalSymmetric except that text is rendered in a downsampled form where possible, sacrificing quality for faster performance.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTextRenderingMode.Outline
member.summary: Specifies that text rendering should be perfomed using geometric outlines.

member.summary: Represents text-drawing parameters which may be applied to a CanvasDrawingSession.

member.summary: Gets the rendering mode option which may be applied to text.

member.summary: Adds an OpenType font feature.

member.summary: Adds an OpenType font feature.

member.summary: Releases all resources used by the CanvasTypography.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeature
member.summary: Describes an OpenType font feature name and its parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeature.Name
member.summary: Identifies which OpenType font feature this is.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeature.Parameter
member.summary: A parameter which is passed to an OpenType font feature.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName
member.summary: Identifies an OpenType font feature.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.None
member.summary: No typography feature specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.Default
member.summary: Indicates a set of default language behaviors.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.VerticalWriting
member.summary: Indicates that the font is displayed vertically.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.VerticalAlternatesAndRotation
member.summary: Replaces normal figures with figures adjusted for vertical display.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.AlternativeFractions
member.summary: Replaces figures separated by a slash with an alternative form.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.PetiteCapitalsFromCapitals
member.summary: Turns capital characters into petite capitals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.SmallCapitalsFromCapitals
member.summary: Turns capital characters into small capitals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.ContextualAlternates
member.summary: In some situations, replaces default glyphs with alternate forms which provide better joining behavior.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.CaseSensitiveForms
member.summary: Shifts various punctuation marks up to a position that works better with all-capital sequences or sets of lining figures; also changes oldstyle figures to lining figures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.GlyphCompositionDecomposition
member.summary: Allows for the decomposing of a character into two glyphs or composition of two characters into a single glyph for better glyph processing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.ContextualLigatures
member.summary: Replaces a sequence of glyphs with a single glyph which is preferred for typographic purposes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.CapitalSpacing
member.summary: Globally adjusts inter-glyph spacing for all-capital text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.ContextualSwash
member.summary: Replaces default character glyphs with corresponding swash glyphs in a specified context.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.CursivePositioning
member.summary: In cursive scripts like Arabic, this feature cursively positions adjacent glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.DiscretionaryLigatures
member.summary: Replaces a sequence of glyphs with a single glyph which is preferred for typographic purposes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.ExpertForms
member.summary: Replaces standard forms in Japanese fonts with corresponding forms preferred by typographers.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.Fractions
member.summary: Replaces figures separated by a slash with 'common' (diagonal) fractions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.FullWidth
member.summary: Replaces glyphs set on other widths with glyphs set on full (usually em) widths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.HalfForms
member.summary: Produces the half forms of consonants in Indic scripts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.HalantForms
member.summary: Produces the halant forms of consonants in Indic scripts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.AlternateHalfWidth
member.summary: Re-spaces glyphs designed to be set on full-em widths, fitting them onto half-em widths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.HistoricalForms
member.summary: Replaces the default (current) forms with the historical alternates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.HorizontalKanaAlternates
member.summary: Replaces standard Japanese kana with forms that have been specially designed for only horizontal writing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.HistoricalLigatures
member.summary: Replaces the default (current) forms with the historical alternates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.HalfWidth
member.summary: Replaces glyphs on proportional widths, or fixed widths other than half an em, with glyphs on half-em (en) widths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.HojoKanjiForms
member.summary: Used to access the JIS X 0212-1990 glyphs for the cases when the JIS X 0213:2004 form is encoded.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.Jis04Forms
member.summary: Enables a subset of NlcKanjiForms, producing glyph forms consistant with JIS X 0213:2004.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.Jis78Forms
member.summary: Replaces default (JIS90) Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS C 6226-1978 (JIS78) specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.Jis83Forms
member.summary: Replaces default (JIS90) Japanese glyphs with the corresponding forms from the JIS X 0208-1983 (JIS83) specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.Jis90Forms
member.summary: Replaces Japanese glyphs from the JIS78 or JIS83 specifications with the corresponding forms from the JIS X 0208-1990 (JIS90) specification.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.Kerning
member.summary: Adjusts amount of space between glyphs, generally to provide optically consistent spacing between glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.StandardLigatures
member.summary: Replaces a sequence of glyphs with a single glyph which is preferred for typographic purposes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.LiningFigures
member.summary: Changes selected figures from oldstyle to the default lining form.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.LocalizedForms
member.summary: Enables localized forms of glyphs to be substituted for default forms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.MarkPositioning
member.summary: Positions mark glyphs with respect to base glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.MathematicalGreek
member.summary: Replaces standard typographic forms of Greek glyphs with corresponding forms commonly used in mathematical notation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.MarkToMarkPositioning
member.summary: Positions marks with respect to other marks.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.AlternateAnnotationForms
member.summary: Replaces default glyphs with various notational forms.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.NlcKanjiForms
member.summary: Used to access glyphs made from glyph shapes defined by the National Language Council (NLC) of Japan for a number of JIS characters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.OldStyleFigures
member.summary: Changes selected figures from the default lining style to oldstyle form.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.Ordinals
member.summary: Replaces default alphabetic glyphs with the corresponding ordinal forms for use after figures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.ProportionalAlternateWidth
member.summary: Respaces glyphs designed to be set on full-em widths, fitting them onto individual (more or less proportional) horizontal widths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.PetiteCapitals
member.summary: Turns lowercase characters into petite capitals.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.ProportionalFigures
member.summary: Replaces figure glyphs set on uniform (tabular) widths with corresponding glyphs set on glyph-specific (proportional) widths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.ProportionalWidths
member.summary: Replaces glyphs set on uniform widths (typically full or half-em) with proportionally spaced glyphs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.QuarterWidths
member.summary: Replaces glyphs on other widths with glyphs set on widths of one quarter of an em (half an en).

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.RequiredLigatures
member.summary: Replaces a sequence of glyphs with a single glyph which is preferred for typographic purposes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.RubyNotationForms
member.summary: Identifies glyphs in the font which have been designed for "ruby", from the old typesetting term for four-point-sized type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Text.CanvasTypographyFeatureName.StylisticAlternates

member.summary: Weights how much the multiplication result (Source1 * Source2) should be included in the output image. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ArithmeticCompositeEffect.ClampOutput
member.summary: If set, the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before passing them on to the next effect in the graph. If false, the effect will not clamp values, although subsequent effects or the output surface may later clamp if they are not of high enough precision. Default value false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorManagementEffectQuality
member.summary: Specifies quality vs. performance tradeoff for ColorManagementEffect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorManagementEffectQuality.Proof
member.summary: The lowest quality mode.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorManagementEffectQuality.Normal
member.summary: Normal quality mode.

summary.p: The best quality mode. This mode requires Direct3D feature level 10_0 or above, as well as floating point precision buffers. This mode supports floating point precision as well as extended range as defined in the ICC v4.3 specification.
Best quality mode is not supported by all GPU hardware. Before specifying Best mode, check .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorManagementRenderingIntent
member.summary: Specifies the ICC (International Color Consortium) rendering intent for use by ColorManagementEffect.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorManagementRenderingIntent.Perceptual
member.summary: The effect compresses or expands the full color gamut of the image to fill the color gamut of the device, so that gray balance is preserved but colorimetric accuracy may not be preserved.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorManagementRenderingIntent.RelativeColorimetric
member.summary: The effect preserves the chroma of colors in the image at the possible expense of hue and lightness.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorManagementRenderingIntent.Saturation
member.summary: The effect adjusts colors that fall outside the range of colors the output device renders to the closest color available. It does not preserve the white point.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorManagementRenderingIntent.AbsoluteColorimetric
member.summary: The effect adjusts any colors that fall outside the range that the output device can render to the closest color that can be rendered. The effect does not change the other colors and preserves the white point.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorMatrixEffect
member.summary: [NoComposition] Alters the colors of an image by applying a 5x4 transform matrix.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorMatrixEffect.ClampOutput
member.summary: If set, the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before passing them on to the next effect in the graph. If false, the effect will not clamp values, although subsequent effects or the output surface may later clamp if they are not of high enough precision. Default value false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ColorMatrixEffect.AlphaMode

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect
member.summary: [NoComposition] Applies an arbitrary 2D filter kernel to an image. This can perform operations such as edge detect, emboss, sharpen, or blur.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConvolveMatrixEffect class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the input source for ConvolveMatrix effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelWidth
member.summary: Width of the filter kernel matrix. Default value 3.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelHeight
member.summary: Height of the filter kernel matrix. Default value 3.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelMatrix
member.summary: The filter kernel matrix. This array must be sized KernelWidth * KernelHeight. Default value {0,0,0,0,1,0,0,0,0}.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelScale
member.summary: Scales how the filter kernel is mapped onto the 2D source image. Default value (1,1).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.KernelOffset
member.summary: Shifts the filter kernel from its default position centered on the output pixel. Default value (0,0).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.Divisor
member.summary: After the filter kernel is applied to a pixel, the result is divided by this value. Default 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.Offset
member.summary: After applying the filter kernel and divisor, this offset is added to the result. Default value 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.InterpolationMode
member.summary: Interpolation mode used to scale the source image to the specified KernelScale. Default value .

summary.p: Specifies whether the convolution filter is applied to alpha as well as the color channels.
When set to false, the filter applies equally to all of the red, green, blue, and alpha channels, operating on premultiplied alpha format data.

When set to true, only the color channels are filtered, while alpha values are kept unchanged. In this case the effect will temporarily unpremultiply the red, green, and blue color component values, apply the filter kernel only to the color channels, and then re-premultiply the result.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.ConvolveMatrixEffect.ClampOutput
member.summary: If set, the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before passing them on to the next effect in the graph. If false, the effect will not clamp values, although subsequent effects or the output surface may later clamp if they are not of high enough precision. Default value false.

member.summary: Gets and sets the border mode for edge pixels.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DisplacementMapEffect.XChannelSelect
member.summary: The effect extracts the intensity from this color channel and uses it to spatially displace the image in the X direction. Default value .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DisplacementMapEffect.YChannelSelect
member.summary: The effect extracts the intensity from this color channel and uses it to spatially displace the image in the Y direction. Default value .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DisplacementMapEffect.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the main input source for DisplacementMap effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DisplacementMapEffect.Displacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the displacement image which is used to distort the main Source image.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DisplacementMapEffect.Amount
member.summary: Scales the intensity of the displacement. The higher you set this property, the more the effect displaces the pixels. Default value 0.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect
member.summary: [NoComposition] Lighting effect creates an image that appears to be an illuminated non-reflective surface. This effect uses the alpha channel as a height map, and lights it with an infinitely distant light source (such as the sun).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DistantDiffuseEffect class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the input source for DistantDiffuse effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.LightColor
member.summary: Color of the incoming light. Default value white.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.LightColorHdr
member.summary: High-dynamic-range color of the incoming light. Default value white.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.HeightMapScale
member.summary: Height map scale factor in the Z direction. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.HeightMapKernelSize
member.summary: Size of the Sobel filter kernel used to convert the input heightmap to surface normal vectors. Default value (1,1).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.HeightMapInterpolationMode
member.summary: Interpolation mode used to filter the height map. Default value .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.Elevation
member.summary: Elevation of the light source, measured in radians in the YZ plane, counter-clockwise relative to the Y axis. Default value 0, range 0 to 2*pi.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.DiffuseAmount
member.summary: Intensity of the diffuse light. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantDiffuseEffect.Azimuth
member.summary: Direction of the light source, measured in radians in the XY plane, counter-clockwise relative to the X axis. Default value 0, range 0 to 2*pi.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantSpecularEffect
member.summary: [NoComposition] Lighting effect creates an image that appears to be a reflective surface. This effect uses the alpha channel as a height map, and lights it with an infinitely distant light source (such as the sun) applying the specular portion of the Phong lighting model.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DistantSpecularEffect class.

member.summary: Specular power for the Phong lighting model. Larger values produce more sharply defined highlights. Default value 1.

member.summary: Intensity of the specular light. Default value 1.

member.summary: Height map scale factor in the Z direction. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantSpecularEffect.HeightMapKernelSize
member.summary: Size of the Sobel filter kernel used to convert the input heightmap to surface normal vectors. Default value (1,1).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantSpecularEffect.HeightMapInterpolationMode
member.summary: Interpolation mode used to filter the height map. Default value .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.DistantSpecularEffect.Elevation
member.summary: Elevation of the light source, measured in radians in the YZ plane, counter-clockwise relative to the Y axis. Default value 0, range 0 to 2*pi.

member.summary: Direction of the light source, measured in radians in the XY plane, counter-clockwise relative to the X axis. Default value 0, range 0 to 2*pi.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EdgeDetectionEffect
member.summary: [Win10] [NoComposition] Filters out the content of an image leaving lines at the edges of contrasting sections.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the EdgeDetectionEffect class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EdgeDetectionEffect.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the input source for EdgeDetection effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EdgeDetectionEffect.Amount
member.summary: Adjusts the sensitivity of the edge detection filter. Default value 0.5, range 0 to 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EdgeDetectionEffect.BlurAmount
member.summary: Specifies the amount of blur to apply before edge detection. Blur is used to remove high frequencies and reduce phantom edges. Default value 0, range 0 to 10.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EdgeDetectionEffect.Mode
member.summary: Specifies what type of filter kernel to use for edge detection. Default value .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EdgeDetectionEffect.OverlayEdges
member.summary: If false, the output image is fully opaque. If true, input opacity is preserved. Default value false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EdgeDetectionEffect.AlphaMode
member.summary: Specifies the treatment of alpha. Default value Premultiplied.

summary.p: [Win10] Specifies what type of filter kernel to use for edge detection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EdgeDetectionEffectMode.Sobel
member.summary: Indicates the Sobel operator should be used for edge detection.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EdgeDetectionEffectMode.Prewitt
member.summary: Indicates the Prewitt operator should be used for edge detection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EffectBorderMode
member.summary: Enumeration type that specifies how to process pixels that lie outside the input image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EffectBorderMode.Soft
member.summary: Pixels outside the input image are treated as transparent black, resulting in a soft edge after processing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EffectBorderMode.Hard
member.summary: The effect clamps to the size of the input image.

member.summary: Enumeration type that specifies speed vs. quality trade-off.

member.summary: Better speed and less quality.

member.summary: Balance between speed and quality.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.EffectOptimization.Quality
member.summary: Maximum quality for this effect is achieved by losing speed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.GammaTransferEffect.ClampOutput

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.MorphologyEffect
member.summary: [NoComposition] Thins or thickens edge boundaries in an image. This effect uses a filter kernel that is 2 times the size you specify. The kernel is centered on the pixel being calculated, and returns the maximum value in the kernel (if dilating) or minimum value (if eroding).

member.summary: Checks whether the pixel shader used by this effect is compatible with the Direct3D feature level of the specified device.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SamplerCoordinateMapping
member.summary: Describes what texture coordinates the shader will use when sampling an input texture.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SamplerCoordinateMapping.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates that the texture coordinate mapping is complex or unknown. This is the default for shaders that specify D2D_INPUT{N}_COMPLEX.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SamplerCoordinateMapping.OneToOne
member.summary: Indicates that the texture coordinate mapping is 1:1 between the source image and pixel being shaded. This is the default for shaders that specify D2D_INPUT{N}_SIMPLE, which should only be used when the shader calls D2DGetInput rather than D2DSampleInputAtOffset or D2DSampleInputAtPosition.

summary.p: Indicates that there is a correlation between the texture coordinates at which the input is sampled and the pixel being shaded, but this is not exactly 1:1. For instance this is the mode to use when a filter kernel calls D2DSampleInputAtOffset to take a number of samples from a region around the pixel itself.

Offset mode is never selected by default. To use it, set one of the Source{N}Mapping properties on , and set
to indicate the maximum number of pixels by which a texture coordinate will be displaced.
Beware: specifying this mode incorrectly (for instance if your shader actually samples further away from the current pixel than the current MaxSamplerOffset) can give unpredictably wrong results.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect
member.summary: [NoComposition] Lighting effect creates an image that appears to be an illuminated non-reflective surface where the light source is limited to a directed cone of light. This effect uses the alpha channel as a height map, and lights it with a point light source.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SpotDiffuseEffect class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the input source for SpotDiffuse effect.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.LimitingConeAngle
member.summary: Angle (in radians) that restricts the region where light is projected. No light is projected outside the cone. Default value pi/2.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.LightTarget
member.summary: Target that the spot light is pointing at. Default value (0,0,0).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.LightPosition
member.summary: Position of the light source. Default value (0,0,0).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.LightColor
member.summary: Color of the incoming light. Default value white.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.LightColorHdr
member.summary: High-dynamic-range color of the incoming light. Default value white.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.HeightMapScale
member.summary: Height map scale factor in the Z direction. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.HeightMapKernelSize
member.summary: Size of the Sobel filter kernel used to convert the input heightmap to surface normal vectors. Default value (1,1).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.HeightMapInterpolationMode
member.summary: Interpolation mode used to filter the height map. Default value .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.Focus
member.summary: Focus of the spot light. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotDiffuseEffect.DiffuseAmount
member.summary: Intensity of the diffuse light. Default value 1.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotSpecularEffect
member.summary: [NoComposition] Lighting effect creates an image that appears to be a reflective surface where the light source is limited to a directed cone of light. This effect uses the alpha channel as a height map, and lights it with a point light source applying the specular portion of the Phong lighting model.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SpotSpecularEffect class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotSpecularEffect.SpecularExponent
member.summary: Specular power for the Phong lighting model. Larger values produce more sharply defined highlights. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotSpecularEffect.SpecularAmount
member.summary: Intensity of the specular light. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotSpecularEffect.Source

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotSpecularEffect.LimitingConeAngle
member.summary: Angle (in radians) that restricts the region where light is projected. No light is projected outside the cone. Default value pi/2.

member.summary: Target that the spot light is pointing at. Default value (0,0,0).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotSpecularEffect.LightPosition
member.summary: Position of the light source. Default value (0,0,0).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotSpecularEffect.LightColor
member.summary: Color of the incoming light. Default value white.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotSpecularEffect.LightColorHdr
member.summary: High-dynamic-range color of the incoming light. Default value white.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.SpotSpecularEffect.HeightMapScale

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect
member.summary: [NoComposition] Generates an image using the Perlin noise function.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TurbulenceEffect class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Tileable
member.summary: Turns stitching on or off. If set, the base frequency is adjusted so the output bitmap can be tiled. Default value false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Size
member.summary: Specifies the size of image to generate. Default value (512, 512).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Seed
member.summary: The seed for the pseudo random generator. Default value 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Offset
member.summary: Offsets the coordinates where the turbulence output is generated. Default value (0,0).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Octaves
member.summary: Number of octaves for the noise function. Default value 1.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Noise
member.summary: The turbulence noise mode. Default value .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffect.Frequency
member.summary: Base frequencies in the X and Y direction. Units are specified in 1/DIPs. Default value (0.01, 0.01).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffectNoise
member.summary: Specifies how turbulence noise should be generated.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffectNoise.FractalSum
member.summary: Computes a sum of the noise octaves, shifting their output range from [-1, 1], to [0, 1].

member.name: F:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Effects.TurbulenceEffectNoise.Turbulence
member.summary: Computes a sum of the absolute value of each noise octave.
